sn22.64:4.2: Then a mendicant went up to the Buddha …
sn22.64:4.4: “Sir, may the Buddha please teach me Dharma in brief. When I’ve heard it, I’ll live alone, withdrawn, diligent, keen, and determined.”
sn22.64:4.6: “When you identify, mendicant, you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:4.7: Not identifying, you’re free from the Wicked One.”
sn22.64:5.1: “But how do you see the detailed meaning of my brief statement?”
sn22.64:5.2: “Sir, when you identify with form you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:5.3: Not identifying, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:5.8: Not identifying, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:5.9: That’s how I understand the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement.”
sn22.64:6.2: It’s good that you understand the detailed meaning of what I’ve said in brief like this.
sn22.64:6.3: When you identify with form you’re bound by Māra.
sn22.64:6.4: Not identifying, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:6.9: Not identifying, you’re free from the Wicked One.
sn22.64:6.10: This is how to understand the detailed meaning of what I said in brief.” …
sn22.64:6.11: And that mendicant became one of the perfected.
